title: Understanding the WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause in SQL is used to filter records. It specifies a condition that each row must meet to be included in the result set.

title: Logical Operators in SQL
text: In SQL, logical operators such as AND, OR, and NOT are used to combine multiple conditions in a WHERE clause. The AND operator requires both conditions to be true, while the OR operator requires at least one condition to be true.

title: Evaluating the Condition
text: The condition WHERE $$Color \neq 'B'$$ OR $$(Size='L'$$ AND Price>20) will include rows where the color is not 'B' or where the size is 'L' and the price is greater than $$20$$.

hintAnswer: Color is 'B', Size is 'XL' and Price is $$10$$.
title: Identifying the Excluded Row
text: Which data row will be left out with this condition in your statement?
choices: Color is 'B', Size is 'L' and Price is $$30$$.
Color is 'W', Size is 'S' and Price is $$20$$.
Color is 'G', Size is 'L' and Price is $$25$$.
Color is 'B', Size is 'XL' and Price is $$10$$.
